answers.answer: I have this too.  I have 32 cm of fluid when 12-14cm is normal.  They have ruled out every thing except a gi problem.  I am being induced wed at 3a.m.  Will let you know how it turns out.  1/2 of women with this condition have it for no known reason....hopefully thAt's us.

Im 38 and expecting my 3rd, I've been so nervous about everything that I just always ask questions and yesterday at my anatomy scan they actually explained that excess of fluid is mostly caused by high sugar intake. Watch your sugar cravings ladies. Praying everything goes well for us all.  :)

Thank you so much....I am trying not to worry but when they told me that the cord could come out first it scared me. Please let me know how things go. Thank you again. Oh is your baby like alot bigger than should be. They told me Ridge is  weeks larger and when I googled it the women on that site had rather large babies.
I dont have gestational diabetes so sugar isnt an issue for me.  Nor is infection or genetic disorders.  They guessed 7lbs 11oz for mine.
They ruled out my diabetes as well...I drink plenty of water and watch my sweets as well. Please let me know how things go for you. I will keep u in my prayers.

question: I was diagnosed with polyhydrominos today. It is excess amniotic fluid. I  passed all of my tests like the diabetes, down syndrome, and rh. I am 39 and I can't help but be scared. They say that he is 7.2 lbs...I am 36 weeks and 3 days. I am just curious if anyone has had this and how things turned out. I have googled it and most of the women had to have emergency c sections. If I had not stayed on them to do another ultrasound they would have never known!!!  Please help ease my mind.
title: polyhydrominos
